intro: Hicorius cordiformis, commonly known as the heart-shaped fern, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Hicoridaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are bioluminescent, emitting a soft glow at night, which aids in attracting nocturnal pollinators. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a conservation priority.
